intro: Rea, commonly known as the rea plant, is a species native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant flowers and foliage. The plant typically features opposite leaves with a smooth texture and bright green color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
